physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical and neurologic examinations were unremarkable.
Patient began to experience episodic discomfort of both legs described as requiring her to move them. Symptoms typically occurred in the late evening and lasted 10 to 30 minutes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms worsened with increases in zonisamide dosage but would dissipate after several days. Symptoms became intolerable with zonisamide monotherapy despite seizure control.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Serum ferritin level was found to be 42 ng/mL.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Supplementation with ferrous sulfate did not improve restless legs symptoms.
